abstract: competitive on line prediction is a strand of learning theory avoiding making any stochastic assumptions about the way the observations are generated . the predictor s goal is to compete with a benchmark class of prediction rules which is often a proper banach function space . metric entropy provides a unifying framework for competitive on line prediction the numerous known upper bounds on the metric entropy of various compact sets in function spaces readily imply bounds on the performance of on line prediction strategies . this paper discusses strengths and limitations of the direct approach to competitive on line prediction via metric entropy including comparisons to other approaches .
